=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/12/03 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['D.J. Caruso'], 'Producers': ['Joe Roth', 'Jeff Kirschenbaum', 'Vin Diesel', 'Samantha Vincent', 'Vince Totino', 'Scott Hemming', 'Ric Kidney', 'Gloria Borders', 'Zack Roth'], 'Starring': ['Vin Diesel', 'Donnie Yen', 'Deepika Padukone']} Review Text: kudos for re-ingniting this bag of turds & accomplishing double douche-bag pre-emptive vomit launch. Everybody justs sleepwalks thru this entire flick. And for Vin before I even cash my check on a mish mash script effectively kills any chance for another sequel for this franchise not that it matters. This franchise deserved a better send off than this. Makes watching paint dry exciting again. And we have cgi over kill and cinema verde' waste of talent. Review Title: massive pile of turds doing a double ollie & back flip Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/01/14 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Français (Canada)', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Français (France)'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Español (Latinoamérica) [CC]', 'Español (España) [CC]', 'Suomi', 'Français [CC]', 'Italiano [CC]', 'Nederlands [CC]', 'Nynorsk', 'Polski', 'Português [SDH]', 'Svenska'], 'Directors': ['Jon Turteltaub'], 'Producers': ['Gerald R. Molen', 'Wayne Wei Jiang', 'Randy Greenberg', 'Catherine Xujun Ying', 'Chantal Nong', 'Barrie M. Osborne', 'Belle Avery', 'Colin Wilson', 'Lorenzo Di Bonaventura'], 'Starring': ['Jason Statham', 'Rainn Wilson', 'Ruby Rose'], 'Studio': ['WARNER HOME VIDEO']} Review Text: sh*t tiered cgi effects, along with lazy throw everything at the wall script leaves the cast almost sleep walking thru this aquamarine turd fest. From uninspired acting, editing and camera work - not even biggest shark ever to grace the screen can make this made for big screen in & out over the weekend 153 plus minute waste of humanity float.
Do yourself a favor & watch paint dry for better entertainment value. Review Title: absolute turd pile Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/02/13 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mark Vizcarra'], 'Producers': ['Victor Vizcarra', 'Michael Vizcarra'], 'Starring': ['Larry Poole', 'Victor Vizcarra', 'Murphy Neal Jones']} Review Text: There was no chance of winning in SE Asia period. From even Pentagons own study , known as Pentagon Papers which examined the US role from 1945 -1967' in the area the real reason for the US involvement in Vietnam was to contain China expanision . One of three fronts long-run effort to contain China (realizing that the USSR "contains" China on the north and northwest):
(a) the Japan–Korea front;
(b) the India–Pakistan front; and
(c) the Southeast Asia front.
The fantasy put forth by political bias in this film is the same insanity that brought the US to bomb Laos, Cambodia & expand the war into US politics that made Watergate topple the Nixon administration in it's pursiut for fatally flawed foriegn & domestic policy. Review Title: Thud Pilots in a massive steamy Dud movie Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/03/05 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Neil Hollander', 'Rick Gordon', 'Mark H Tuttle'], 'Producers': ['Peter Maris', 'Donna K Tuttle', 'Mark H Tuttle'], 'Starring': ['Neil Armstrong']} Review Text: First off Neil Armstrong is a god. Awesome narration. But this aviation series suffers major flaws , mistakes in so many areas it would take pages just to list. So for example lets look at episode 13 that centers on jets. The myth that german aviation specifically the TA -183 heavily influenced the Mig-15 . MiG-15 is merely a progression of the MiG-9 using information that was generally understood after the WWII. The MiG-9 was developed before any of the Ta-183 data was avalible and Ta-183's key feature was the high T-tail which was also its greatest short coming. The design history of the MiG-15 is available from the Mikoyan OKB Archives. English-language secondary sources include Mikoyan OKB by Bill Gunston, Soviet Secret Projects (Fighters) by Tony Buttler and MiG-15 by Yefim Gordon. All the authors are internationally respected and authoritative sources and all have concluded that the Ta-183 and MiG-15 are not related. Incidently in Tony Buttler's book he reveals that one rejected layout for the MiG-15 had forward-swept wings. Review Title: another aviation series with some major flaws Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/04/02 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Various'], 'Starring': ['Christopher Lee', 'Peter Read'], 'Studio': ['HDP']} Review Text: The 2nd Film is a horror gem from1964 - Dementia 13' and is Francis Ford Coppola's first flick, his directorial debut. Yeah, that's right. The man that brought you Apocalypse Now and The Godfather worked first in horror. Review Title: Under rated horror gems Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Shepherd Review Date: 2019/04/05 Categories: Drama, Faith and Spirituality, Easygoing, Tense Product Description: ['Exciting "top gun" action and conflict in the lives of the men who push the edge of danger defending our skies.'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Donald W. Thompson'], 'Producers': ['Donald W. Thompson', 'Peg Courter', 'Russell S. Doughten Jr.'], 'Starring': ['Christopher Stone', 'Dee Wallace', 'Pepper Martin']} Review Text: The box art cover is a instant classic. A pilot in full flight suit holding a lamb. Supersonic good clean fun with jets & explosion & stuff. Instant tear jerker. And lambs. Review Title: nothing to do with interspecies sex Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/05/29 Average Rating: 3.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Xiao Feng'], 'Producers': ['Benjamen Chen', 'Stephen J. Eads', 'Haiyang Jiang', 'Jian-Xiang Shi'], 'Starring': ['Bruce Willis', 'Ye Liu', 'Adrien Brody'], 'Studio': ['tribecashortlist']} Review Text: And Bruce Willis sleepwalks thru this mess for a paycheck - so much cgi is thrown at the screen it overpowers what little screen writing, drama that remains. Besides the japanese fighter zero did not make it first flight until April 1939' was not deployed to China until 1940' in very small numbers with the 12th Rengo Kōkūtai . Dog fighting scenes are wasted with over the top cgi mish mash. Best to watch this with eyes closed & fast asleep for desired effect. thumbs down. Review Title: air turd Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/07/12 Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Fedor Bondarchuk'], 'Producers': ['Fedor Bondarchuk', 'Aleksandr Andryushchenko', 'Michael Kitaev', 'Elena Nelidova', 'Dmitriy Rudovskiy', 'Alina Tyazhlova', 'Mikhail Vrubel', 'Anton Zlatopolskiy'], 'Starring': ['Irina Starshenbaum', 'Alexander Petrov', 'Rinal Mukhametov'], 'Studio': ['Dark Sky Films']} Review Text: Already re-gurgitated alien invasion genre & theme flogged to death. Sleep induced script & snail mail delivered acting topped off with shit tiered english delivery by a cast of unknowns. CGI efx cannot save this steamy pile of excrement. Review Title: another sci fi turdfest Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/07/29 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ken Hughes'], 'Producers': ['Albert R. Broccoli'], 'Starring': ['Dick Van Dyke', 'Sally Ann Howes'], 'Studio': ['MGM STUDIOS INC']} Review Text: Spirited Disney musical starring a car. Fun cinema fact. In 1968' Chitty Chitty Bang Bang & another movie starring Steve McQueen & car ( Green 1968 390 v8 Ford Mustang GT fastback ) both released in theaters almost within mere months of each other that year.. Both have awesome car chases that set the standard for everything after. Review Title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang goat. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/07/31 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joe Penna'], 'Producers': ['Tim Zajaros', 'Christopher Lemole', 'Noah Haeussner'], 'Starring': ['Mads Mikkelsen', 'Maria Smáradóttir'], 'Studio': ['BLEECKER STREET FILMS']} Review Text: Tight, lean mean survival genre. thumbs up ! Review Title: brrrrrrr,...survival movie Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/09/27 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['Русский'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kim Druzhinin'], 'Producers': ['Dmitriy Sherbanov', 'Oleg Antipov'], 'Starring': ['Andrey Merzlikin', 'Aglaya Tarasova', 'Anton Filipenko'], 'Studio': ['Syndicado']} Review Text: Who knew that even though it was springtime for Hitler & Germany and it's former 'BFF' Soviet Union although very butthurt over being cockblocked after helping nazi Germany invade Poland kicking off WW2 , still has wunderkind T-34 tank up it's sleeve. Our intrepid T-34 must first overcome Soviet Union state bureaucracy and save the day for Stalin & commies worldwide. Follow along as soviet strong T-34 overcomes all and makes the world safe for Stalin again. Review Title: commie love fiesta Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2023/01/03 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Bay'], 'Producers': ['Don Murphy', 'Tom Desanto', 'Lorenzo Di Bonaventura', 'Ian Bryce', 'Steven Spielberg', 'Michael Bay', 'Brian Goldner', 'Mark Vahradian'], 'Starring': ['Mark Wahlberg', 'Nicola Peltz Beckham', 'Stanley Tucci'], 'Studio': ['MGMPLUS']} Review Text: Everything blows up & who needs a script , lots of eye candy. enjoy. raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user has experienced several positive interactions with various products. High ratings of 4.5 and 5.0 reflect a clear appreciation for certain genres, particularly in airline narratives and classic musicals. Positive commentary focuses on enjoyable elements such as engaging visuals, nostalgic content, and quality performances. The user recognizes and praises specific aspects like captivating narration and exciting action, indicating a preference for films that provide strong emotional or visual stimulation.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
Negative experiences dominate the user's purchase history, evidenced by multiple 1.0 ratings. Users express dissatisfaction with poor CGI effects, uninspired scripts, and lackluster performances across various films. Negative reviews feature harsh language and suggest feelings of frustration towards wasted talent and uninspiring storytelling. A recurring theme is the sentiment of disappointment, where movies failed to meet expectations or seemed to suffer from tired tropes and overused CGI.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
The user's purchase history presents a mixed experience with a predominant trend of discontent. While the user has enjoyed some high-quality content that scores highly, the overall sentiment leans towards dissatisfaction due to numerous poorly received films. The disparity between enjoyed narratives and overwhelming dissatisfaction highlights the user's desire for substance and quality in cinematic storytelling, revealing a consistent struggle with typical industry shortcomings.

target_interaction.title: rainy day goodness
target_interaction.text: charming with hint bitter sweet love & lost.
